definitions.definition: The tendency to work persistently. Diligence.
definitions.example: Over the years, their industry and business sense made them wealthy.

definitions.definition: Businesses of the same type, considered as a whole. Trade.
definitions.example: The software and tourism industries continue to grow, while the steel industry remains troubled.

definitions.definition: Businesses that produce goods as opposed to services.
(in the singular) The sector of the economy consisting of large-scale enterprises.
definitions.example: There used to be a lot of industry around here, but now the economy depends on tourism.

definitions.definition: A typological classification of stone tools, associated with a technocomplex.
